name: haunted artifact: GBA SP
description: I found this in a thrift store I had never seen before. It's a hole in the wall type, tucked inbetween two other shops, barely even visible, and situated in the old part of town. When I got in, I was instantly struck by the quantity, variety, and most of all, quality of the items presented. Long story short, I brought home a n*ntendo gameboi advance SP in seemingly very good condition. I remember getting home all excited and eager to turn it on and play, and that instant feeling of disappointment when I realized it would only show a white screen for a few seconds and automatically turn off. My deception although, quickly shifted to curiosity: I have this console for 3 days now, and despite no more attempts trying to turn it on, I did see the screen light up again. Every evening, when I get back in my room after leaving the console closed and turned off inside a shut drawer in the morning, something is here to welcome me in. The console, out of its drawer, proudly on the table, opened, screen on. When I approach it, a glitchy smile greets me for a couple seconds before shutting off again. I obviously try to turn it back on instantly, only granted by the disapoiting white screen.It was not the last time I would see that glitchy smile though. It has been showing itself to me at least once each day since I brought it home with me, at its own will, as if it can sense whenever I get home, as if it wants to greet me.
